geeklist.title: '23 Dice Tower West Virtual Flea Market
geeklist.description:
[center][b]DTW kicks off March 8th, but why wait to spend money until then? On the flip side, maybe you'll sell a few items ahead of time so you can buy more stuff when you get there![/b]
[IMG]https://static.wixstatic.com/media/41d157_53fc1511dcec4a6b98175ae3a6eb0e37~mv2_d_1372_1474_s_2.gif[/IMG][/center]
[b]What's this list for?[/b]
If you have items you'd like to sell at Dice Tower West, you can list them here. This is not part of the physical flea market that is happening at the con. This is just a forum to work out deals in advance of the con, so you can pack/plan accordingly.
[b]***Scheduled meet-up Friday 10 AM.***[/b]
[imageid=7381866 medium]
Not everyone will be able to make this. It's recommended that you exchange contact info and touch base with your trade partner(s) before the con.
********************************************************************************
[b]Guidelines[/b]
When you list your item, include the condition of the game and the price you'd like to sell it for. It's up to you to decide how you want the item to be sold (e.g. Fixed price, auction, best offer, etc). The transaction will be handled by you from beginning to end. Don't get offended by offers below your asking price. This is a format where haggling is accepted, if not expected.
Please be aware, not everyone attends the entire convention. If this is you, it's helpful to list when you will/won't be there to avoid missing your buyer/seller.
[b]Don't be a jerk![/b] By agreeing to buy/sell a game, your partner is counting on you to keep your word. They are losing the chance to buy/sell with another person. Please only agree if you plan on honoring your word. If life happens and you won't be able to complete your transaction, please send them a direct message asap. Also, there is no need to publicly questions prices. The market will dictate the value, it's not up to you to police it:cool:
It's best not to delete sold listings. This is your proof of the agreed price and condition. Just mark them as "sold" or change the photo to one that says "sold". You can change the picture id to 6602898 & it will display this :arrowS:.
[ImageID=6602898 micro]
Be careful of double listing 1 game. If you plan on listing a game here and in the math trade, make sure you don't commit it to 2 people. Remove it from the math trade as soon as you have a deal here, or hold off on listing it until after the trade.
********************************************************************************
Most transactions will be handled at the con (ie: exchange cash for the game). You are expected to process your transactions in the Marketplace to pay BGG their 3% commission on all sales assisted by this site. The 3% is automatically added to Geek Marketplace transactions.
There are a couple of ways you can capture the items you have sold on the list:
1. List each transaction in the marketplace. There is a quick link to do this under each of your listings. Then, send your buyer the link for the listing.
2. You can also create a marketplace dummy sale item something like "Miscellaneous - DTW23 VFM Commission" as the item type/description and price it at whatever ends up being your total for sales, then "buy" it yourself. This will generate a seller's invoice via geek mail for the 3% commission payable by PayPal.
3. BGG's commission is on the honor system and will not be policed by me.
******************************************************************************** Amazing tools provided by [user=Carnage994][/user]
Alpha List of Games Offered: https://yulgame.com/Vfm/Items/308714 Quick add tool: https://yulgame.com/Vfm/AddItems/308714
You can post games you're wanting to buy here: [geeklist=308716][/geeklist]

Hope that helps.

Those of you doing auctions... couple of tips I've seen work in my last 7 years doing VFM...
1. Put an end time that isn't 3 days before the con. People don't want to wait that long and some people go off a budget and they want to know what they are buying ahead of time... (or luggage needs.) 2. Make people bid often by having an auction that works like this, "the auction will end after a bid sits uncontested for X amount of days." It makes people bid often and early! 3. Start your auction off with a low dollar amount. Each bid causes a ping and people will see the bid. They might jump in. If you set the starting bid a $45 with a BIN at $55, a bunch of people will keep scrolling.
Just ideas... but please please please put the terms of your auction in the listing and state when it will end.
I will consider offers, but I will most likely give discounts to bundle offers.

A couple of quick notes:
1) If you want to ship your games to Vegas rather than paying for bags, send me a GM. As long as I don't have a U-Hauls worth of demand, I'm happy to help. I am also trying to think of a way to help people ship games home affordably.
2) A quick way to make sure you haven't missed any offers or questions about your listings is to use the alpha list (https://yulgame.com/Vfm/Items/308714). Sort by seller and check listings that have a value in the "Bids/Comments" column.
3) Cashless options(venmo, PayPal, zelle) may have tax consequences for 2023. I've been moving cashless, but this puts a wrinkle in those plans.
[q="Bulkoth"]almost 100 pages! quick, post more games![/q] We’re outpacing last year!
what does BIN or SB mean?

[q="bubbles949"]what does BIN or SB mean?[/q] BIN is "Buy it Now". Basically give me this price and it's yours.
SB is "Starting Bid". That is where the seller is asking for the lowest bid on a game start if it is an auction-type sale.

[q="somahead"][q="bubbles949"]what does BIN or SB mean?[/q] BIN is "Buy it Now". Basically give me this price and it's yours.
SB is "Starting Bid". That is where the seller is asking for the lowest bid on a game start if it is an auction-type sale. [/q] And I guess FP is "Fixed Price" which means you cant bid higher. Just learned that.

It would be great if people didn't delete listings! You can simply edit/comment if something is no longer for sale.

[q="nyfilmfest"]It would be great if people didn't delete listings! You can simply edit/comment if something is no longer for sale.[/q]
I much prefer they delete so that I don't get a million subscription updates.
Do you have a good reason people shouldn't delete?

[q="Bulkoth"][q="nyfilmfest"]It would be great if people didn't delete listings! You can simply edit/comment if something is no longer for sale.[/q]
I much prefer they delete so that I don't get a million subscription updates.
Do you have a good reason people shouldn't delete? [/q]
Unsubscribe?
I keep track of the item #s. I also keep track of the urls, so it's just a redundancy.

It also leaves a record of the listing in case it needs to be referenced by either party leading up to the event.
Once an item sells it has very little action anyways. And you can hide any listing you aren't interested in if you subscribe to the entire thread. Easier to do as the list populates for sure.
Also prevents people from deleting and relisting items just because they didn't sell, which no one is doing AFAIK, but would be bad form.

None of those are what's happening, no one is deleting sold items or relisting, they are deleting things no longer for sale.
If you just bid on stuff you're interested in you can use your own "contributions" page instead of keeping a separate list. 👍

Every listing has a unique URL extension. I addressed that two dozen posts ago in this comment thread.
Asking several dozen sellers to not delete listings is like trying to herd cats. Not worth the headache, so just track the unique URL extensions.

Other VFM threads I've participated in have it as a rule. It's not hard to have rules that people follow.
This one doesn't. Fair enough. I can cope.

Just to help those out who are heading to the Virtual Flea Market Exchange. Make yourself a sign before heading out with your name and BGG name. That way you aren't just waiting to hear your name called amongst the other 50 names being called out. People can meander through the tables and spot you much easier.
Also. I printed out my QR codes for PayPal and VenMo last year so people could easily get to my account. I don't like exchanging money until goods are exchanged so it can get pretty overwhelming to constantly help people find your account in the app.
The distance from the rooms to the conference room is pretty far. Even in the Ipanema tower. So if you are bringing or buying a lot keep that in mind. I'm taking a foldable dolly this year to help with my bags I'm taking.

The distance from the rooms to the conference room is pretty far. Even in the Ipanema tower. So if you are bringing or buying a lot keep that in mind. I'm taking a foldable dolly this year to help with my bags I'm taking. [/q]

First timer here and I have some questions. Friday morning at 10 am- is this time only for the VFM trades or for the regular flea market as well? Can I sell games at the regular flea market? If yes, do I have to register somewhere or just show up? Is there enough table space for everyone to display their games? Thanks 🙂

[q="itzbharath"]First timer here and I have some questions. Friday morning at 10 am- is this time only for the VFM trades or for the regular flea market as well? Can I sell games at the regular flea market? If yes, do I have to register somewhere or just show up? Is there enough table space for everyone to display their games? Thanks 🙂 [/q]
The non-virtual flea market is on Saturday 10a-1pm. If you want to sell, you need to reserve a table for $20 (at my.cardboardevents website).

[q="dallasstars945"]Why aren't we doing something like they do at BGG CON and have tables in alphabetical order by username so ppl know where the heck you are...[/q]
In order to facilitate, they limit participation. I'm not interested in doing that.
[q="itzbharath"]First timer here and I have some questions. Friday morning at 10 am- is this time only for the VFM trades or for the regular flea market as well? Can I sell games at the regular flea market? If yes, do I have to register somewhere or just show up? Is there enough table space for everyone to display their games? Thanks 🙂 [/q]
Thanks for addressing this, Dian. You are correct. This VFM/MT meet-up is Friday morning. You only want to show up to execute the deals you've already made here or in the Math Trade.
On Saturday there will be a huge flea market. Last year, folks started lining up almost 2 hours before the doors opened and there were approx 300 people in line at doors open. We had a small space and had to limit how many could enter. This year, our space is massive and should be able to let everyone it at the same time. If you want to sell, you need to buy a table. If you want to buy, bring something to play while you're in line, or just swing in after the madness of opening :)

Closing as we get nearer to the trip - if anyone has any last-minute interest in this item please contact me via GeekMail.
[-]First Kickstarter edition, meaning it has the promo corporations and cards and the resource trays. Like new - played a handful of times.
$40 or best offer - just looking to get the KS cost back. (The card art was a hit, but the action selection system made folks in my group just want to play regular Mars.)[/-]

UPDATE: Marking as Sold to Curtis Davis for $40 so that I can begin planning for the trip.
English edition and includes [thing=301357]Alchemists[/thing], as well as some cute storage boxes and hard plastic card cases. Like new, played twice.
$50 or best offer. (I like drafting and particularly dice drafting, though in this game you try to [i]avoid[/i] drafting new dice as much as possible. Wasn't what I expected, though otherwise a solid game.)
item.comment: Would you sell the expansion separately at $7?
No, I wouldn't have any confidence in it getting through air travel without getting damaged (it's nothing but a small stack of cards). It's at least safe in the box.
Would you take $40 by chance?
Sure! I'll leave the listing up in case someone offers $50, but $40 would be perfectly fine.
K, my number is 702-493-0553. I'll be at the con almost the entire time.

item.body:
3D Printed Snap On Bases for Tapestry and Both Expansions - $15
[-]I have created snap-on bases for all 18 Landmark Buildings in the base game, as well as the 7 Landmark Buildings in the Plots & Ploys expansion, and the 8 Landmark Buildings in the Arts & Architecture expansion. They fit perfectly on the capital city mat. Each set of 33 bases is color matched to the advancement track they belong to, yellow for the tech card bases, silver for space tiles, copper for Tapestry cards, and dark blue for Landmark Cards. Each base has the name of the building visible on the base.
Since I designed these, I have multiple sets.
[ImageID=6601261]
[ImageID=6601257]
[ImageID=6601255]
[ImageID=5058052][/-] Suitcase full, listing closed. 1 set to [user=awrighter][/user]

item.body:
Like new, never played, in box.
$50

Kickstarter Legend Pledge. Opened, played a few times, very good to new condition.
Ah, a living legend! By backing at this pledge level, your rewards include everything from the Hero pledge plus the exclusive Lost Levels gameplay expansion.
That means the Legend Pledge includes: ♫ Bardsung Core Box ♫ Exclusive Lost Levels Expansion ♫ Exclusive Gladestrider Hero ♫ Exclusive Oni Wandering Monster ♫ All Unlocked Quest Goals ♫ All Daily Unlocks
Because there’s already so much to experience in the core game—over 70 hours, and with our guest writers adding new adventures on top—the Lost Levels is Bardsung’s only gameplay expansion in this campaign.
So, we’ve created the Legend pledge to keep things simple. It includes a colossal discount of $91 (£73) on the MSRP equivalent. And the elf-eyed among you will notice it also comes with an on-Kickstarter discount of $5.
If gameplay is your focus, the Legend pledge level is for you. More info The Legend Pledge includes: https://gamefound.com/projects/steamforged-games/bardsung?ref=search
This is one large and two 'normal' sized game boxes
BIN: $125

I'm cheap and wanted to save a few bucks and deserve to get punished every so often 😅 Also thanks for saving me the room in my suitcase!

[-][b]$30[/b][/-] [b]SOLD for $30 to [/b][user=Eliian][/user]

[b]Update:[/b] Someone requested pictures of my sweet insert mod. I cut the channel out of the center "wall" to give the player boards a place to sit flat. And no, they didn't fit sideways in the bottom half - at least not cleanly. Plus, this is just the right depth to then allow the central board to sit flat on top of all this. I also used a punchboard section to try to keep the little tiles in place when stored.

item.body:
***THIS IS NOT FOR THE GAME ITSELF***
I have an extra set of deluxe wooden tokens and metal coins for Mosaic. If you're curious what they look like, check out the Kickstarter page, as this is a complete set of the deluxe bits that were available via the Kickstarter as an add on (they came included with the game if you got the Colossus Edition, and available as an add-on set if you ordered an edition other than Colossus).
The set comes with:
- Two types of wooden food tokens (1-wood and 5-wood denominations) - Two types of wooden stone tokens (1-stone and 5-stone denominations) - Two types of wooden ideas tokens (1-idea and 5-ideas denominations) - Set of metal coins in 1-, 5- and 10-coin denominations
These were never used and remain sealed and shrink wrapped.
Not sure what the going rate would be for these, so I'll start the bidding at $10 and sell to the highest bidder.
Once the bidding gets going, I'll plan to close the auction once there's been no action for a few days
Traded for Taluva to [user=burybryce][/user]
item.comment: In for a $10

[q="AKgrumpy1937"]$22[/q]
Sold!!

item.body:
[b]$90[/b] - please read details below
This is a huge bundle stored in the Heat Wave box. I'm pretty sure this is the $130 Commissioner pledge level from the Career KS campaign ([url]https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/vanrydergames/hostage-negotiator-career?ref=nav_search&result=project&term=hostage%20negotiator[/url]).
Note that it appears to include all 10 abductor packs [b]except #8[/b] - for some reason there are 2 cards from 8 but none of the rest. I'm not sure if it was removed for some reason, or this was actually the $100 level (this included 9 and 10, plus any 7 others) with some extras (like the meeples) included as add-ons.
It includes the base game, Career, Heat Wave, both sets of screen printed meeples, and various extras -- all in great shape. To be honest, I'm not super familiar with this game so doing a full inventory of an all-in KS version is tricky. I did check all of the cards in the dividers and it seems like everything from the KS is there (except pack #8, mentioned above). There are extra dividers with other stuff, but I don't think those came with the KS. The Career stuff is still in it's box and everything inside is unopened. Most of the cards are sleeved and it looks like it was maybe played once or twice (a few of the packs were out of order in the dividers). The enveloped items are unopened.
Full bundle seems to sell for $150-200. Since #8 is missing and I'm not 100% sure on some of this, I'll offer this for [b]$90[/b].

item.objectname: Professor Evil and The Citadel of Time
item.body:
Condition: Like new, played 3-4 times
$15

[-]Obscurity!
Technically, this game is the collector's edition, but it's in pretty awful condition. All the collectible movers are there. I have no idea what to do with this, so feel free to shoot me an offer. [/-]
SOLD!
item.comment: $5 - no box needed if you wanted to save on luggage space
Are you wanting all the components (just without the box), or only some?
Are we talking the box is in awful condition? Or the pieces as well? Wondering how the money/property/chance/community chest cards are looking. Cheers!
Just the pieces. Really I actually only need the "houses/hotels" and the Mewtoo and Charmander characters to make my son's game complete

Hi Ben! I mean, I hate to say this, but nothing is in great condition. Most of the money is good (though slightly warped) and the majority of the cards are looking pretty worn. I had this and played it when I was much younger and didn't really care about keeping it nice 😅.
Unless you're really interested (or want some of the other movers maybe), I think I'll go ahead and sell the pieces to Ginger to complete her son's set :)
All Gingers 🙂 Thanks for the quick response!

Ginger, fun to know your son has the set. Is he into Pokémon?
I can totally do just the pieces. If I'm going to bring those, do you want me to bring the rest of the movers (backups?), or anything else? Just let me know

[q="ICDAT_SC30"]Ginger, fun to know your son has the set. Is he into Pokémon?
I can totally do just the pieces. If I'm going to bring those, do you want me to bring the rest of the movers (backups?), or anything else? Just let me know[/q]
Thank you! Yes, he has always loved Pokemon 🙂 If you want to bring the extra pieces I will put them aside for spares but if not that's okay too. Thanks so much!

item.body:
A few years ago there was a game subscription service called Battle Bin. They sent out Loot crates with various small games, promos and accessories.
One of those items was an early demo set for Rum and Bones. It included 2 captains, a handful of pirates a small deck of cards, various tokens (including acrylic damage tokens) and card stock skirmish board. I think all of it was part of the first version of the retail game. A great way to get your feet wet or to fill out your pirate armies, or practice painting. See pics for what is included. Everything is new and unplayed. The board has some minor wear (it actually didn't fit the battle bin box very well.)
(The box is about 6"x6" so the board is separate flat piece.)

item.body:
From Original D-Day Dice Kickstarter Campaign. New in Shrink.
[-]$4[/-] $3

From Original D-Day Dice Kickstarter Campaign. New in Shrink.
[-]$3[/-] $2

Crochet "Bird Nest" Bowls
My daughter loves to crochet and made me some little bowls to use as nests for Wingspan. I loved them so much I suggested making a few more to sell. She also made a few little draw bags and has one left.
Note that in the images below, the Wingspan eggs used are what's included in the base game, so 1 large bowl or 2 smalls work great (maybe more if you have expansions or extras). Of course, you can certainly use them for other stuff as well. The Crew is shown to give approximate scale.
[b]Large Bowls $8 each (2 available):[/b] [ImageID=7350275 inline] [ImageID=7350276 inline]
[-][b]Small Bowls $5 each (5 available):[/b][/-] SOLD 5 pictured for $20 to [user=WorkWithMorgan][/user] and 2 others for $10 to [user=AmanJohns][/user] [ImageID=7350277 inline] [ImageID=7350278 inline]
[b]Small Draw Bag $8 (1 available):[/b] [ImageID=7350280 inline] [ImageID=7350279 inline]

item.body:
This is NOT for the game.
This is for two 3D printed, Dwellings Of Eldervale: Dungeon Tray Stands. [b]$15[/b] for set (2 stands) - Multiple Sets Available.
I love Dwellings of Eldervale! During my first game, I couldn’t read the dungeon tray cards on the other end of the table. Making it very hard to strategize. Sooo... I designed these Dungeon Tray Stands. They save table space, and make it easier for all players to read the cards! I also like using the lid of the box to raise one stand higher. It’s functional and looks awesome! Plus they fit in the box!
More Photos: https://www.facebook.com/adrenacreative/
I'll be at DTW Friday-Sunday
Note: Printed filament color is black.
[imageid=7351570 medium]
item.comment: Looks great! I'll take these
Great! I'll message you to schedule pickup. 🙂
Do you have them gray like in the picture?
@Anthony Avelar I painted the ones in the photos. They're printed in black filament. Message me if you'd like to get a set. 🙂

item.body:
[-]Collector's Edition includes 30 metal point tokens, 6 wooden rat workers, 20 wooden Occupied tokens with stickers, deluxe 8-sided die, Legendary expansion, Extra! Extra! cards, and Rugwort! Slip cover has VERY minor damage (looks worse in attached pics than it really is, as these are extreme closeups). Some scuffing on slipcover, box itself is pristine.
Starting bid: [b][size=18]$75[/size][/b] Closing bids sometime on March 1st.
I will be at the con all 5 days, arriving Tues evening.
[imageid=7359699][imageid=7359700][/-]
The damage on the slipcover truly is very tiny. But I guess that is still too much. Anyhow, I own this game and have played it, but it just didn't do anything for me. I'd rather see someone who really enjoys the game to own it instead. Those metal point tokens are pretty sweet. And the expansion stuff seems pretty cool. I just think there are others out there who would enjoy it a lot more. Others are selling this for $85-99 on eBay and Amazon, so I thought my price was fair. If you want it, email me an offer before noon March 5. Not sure if I'll be bringing this with me or not, otherwise.

item.comment: I’ll buy for $40
I'll offer $45

[q="burybryce"]I'll offer $45[/q]
I don’t believe this is an auction. FP is fixed price.
I tried ;) … some do them as auctions

[q="burybryce"]I tried ;) … some do them as auctions[/q]
You're totally right. Since I've seen you make this accidental oops a few times, I thought I'd share the easy way to tell:
* [b]Auctions[/b] literally always say auctions or "bid" on them. They tend to be less common and the seller is always super clear in stating that they are an auction.
* [b]Non-Auction[/b]. Typically these just have a price. Sometimes they say FP (fixed price) or BIN (buy it now). The key thing is that they don't mention the word auction or bid.
Hope that helps and have a great DTW!

item.comment:
Mr. [user=Bentadams1][/user] has informed me that the app for this game has been removed for the App Store, and is likely unplayable for anyone “new” to this game. If you have the app, apparently you can still play it? In addition, you can still use the expansion cards if you already have the game…so I won’t take down the listing and would entertain offers on any part.
I’m not sure about the whole scenario but I appreciate Ben letting me (us) know that and don’t want to mislead anyone. :)

Ben’s information is accurate. We got the game and app just before it came down from the App Store.
My Wife is a music teacher and she runs a music studio from our home. We have a copy of the base game and might be interested in the expansion cards. If you want to off load the whole thing I can take it off your hands but my main interest would be the cards. I hope it goes without saying, but I don’t relish the idea of spending $25 for the lot. I would potentially offer $10 for the card. Let me know what you think.

[q="AmanJohns"]Ben’s information is accurate. We got the game and app just before it came down from the App Store.
My Wife is a music teacher and she runs a music studio from our home. We have a copy of the base game and might be interested in the expansion cards. If you want to off load the whole thing I can take it off your hands but my main interest would be the cards. I hope it goes without saying, but I don’t relish the idea of spending $25 for the lot. I would potentially offer $10 for the card. Let me know what you think. [/q]
Hey Alan. Glad to let the whole thing go for $10. You’d be doing me a favor by helping me relinquish some shelf space. Let me know if you’re still interested. 🙂
Travis.
Yeah, that sounds good. Now I have to find room on our board game shelves 😂. I will have cash for you at the 10:00am Friday virtual flea market meetup if that works ok for you.

[q="AmanJohns"]Yeah, that sounds good. Now I have to find room on our board game shelves 😂. I will have cash for you at the 10:00am Friday virtual flea market meetup if that works ok for you.[/q]

AMAZING trick-taker. Can't recommend it enough. This copy is open, but in very good condition. A few cards have a tiny bit of ink smearing, which is common with this edition, but does not affect gameplay or card readability. Comes with both English and Japanese rules. item.body:
This is NOT for the game.
I have 2 [b]Dwellings of Eldervale Upgrade Packs[/b] available.
1- [b]Castle and Shard Modules[/b] - $20 - Includes 6 castles and 24 shards. Add even more variety to your Dwellings adventures. The Castles and Shards are Official modules designed by Luke Laurie and can be found on BGG.
2- [b]Dungeon Tray Stands[/b] - $15 - Includes 2 stands. I love Dwellings of Eldervale! During my first game, I couldn’t read the dungeon tray cards on the other end of the table. Making it very hard to strategize. Sooo... I designed these Dungeon Tray Stands. They save table space, and make it easier for all players to read the cards! I also like using the lid of the box to raise one stand higher. It’s functional and looks awesome! Plus they fit in the box! Note: Printed filament color is black.
I'll be at DTW Friday-Sunday Please message me if you'd like either upgrade pack!

item.body:
If you had Trapper Keepers in school when you were a kid, then you’ll feel an instant connection to the game packaging and components. As for gameplay, it’s fun collecting cards, making sets, and reading all of the humorous notes, homework assignments, and reasons for detention. Has the same weight and feel as Sushi Go! and Cat Lady. Very good condition.

item.body:
Rare and out of print Mattel English edition (2011), as pictured. Specifically, the yellow soda can edition. Components and tin container are in very good condition.
BIN: $15

[imageid=6770940] Out of print Nina Chanel Abney version (2020), as pictured, in the UNO Artiste series (#3).
This special edition deck features original artwork created by Abney specifically for the Artiste Series. The Chicago-born contemporary artist is known for her vivid paintings that broach subjects as diverse as religion, politics, sex, and celebrity, while brilliantly illustrating them in a way that produces sensory overload. Abney’s bold graphic aesthetic nods to a pop-cubist style, often incorporating elements of abstraction and bracing use of color.
Box open, but cards are new in shrink. Box in sturdy condition except for discoloration in a few places, as pictured below.
BIN: $15
[imageid=6771665]

[imageid=7388588 medium] Super high quality Wegiel handmade European Ambassador chess set. Made out of beech and birch. Chess board and pieces are in very good condition. The flimsy sales box is in good condition.
BIN: $30 [imageid=7388587] [imageid=7388590]

[imageid=3638386] Rare out of print Ravensburger (2017) edition, as pictured. The box has a few slight imperfections on the outside, but inside it's all still in shrink and brand new.

Box open, but everything inside is new and unpunched.
BIN: $15

[imageid=7388617 medium]
For those of you who like the theme and artwork in [thing=266192][/thing], this is a great alternative to play with friends and family members who aren’t gamers. Gorgeous illustrations and thick cardboard tiles and boards. Features 64 different species of birds. Must supply own draw bag, but components are all in very good condition.
BIN: $10

[imageid=7388642] A really unique edition of Risk in a round tin. Great player piece holders that can be used in any game! The embossed tin cover is also cool with the horse ready to jump right off the face of it. Components in very good condition. Tin has a few dings. Looks to be from 2003.
BIN: $15 [imageid=7388644 medium]

item.body:
Out of print Knizia that comes in a nice tin. Very good condition.
BIN: $10

Looks amazing on the table. Great building components! Really fun to build up and out as you create the shared cityscape. Lots of interesting scoring opportunities. Very good condition.
[u][b]BONUS:[/b][/u] [thing=270032][/thing]
BIN: $20

[b][u]Ganymede Bundle[/u][/b]
Stylish game and box art. Lots of interesting decisions to make as you progress your settlers from Earth to Mars to Ganymede. Gameplay is definitely focused on engine building and set collection, if those are mechanics that you enjoy.
Comes with the base game (very good condition) and the [thing=266181][/thing] expansion (like new - open, but unplayed).
[-]BIN: $25[/-]
